item.description:
This is a reposting of this hike.
I am planning another section of the Appalachian Trial for a day hike. I know this falls early on Father's Day but I am hoping others, like myself, do not have plans that day. You could definitely make dinner with Dad.

This hike will cover a very steep section where we will climb Mt. Everett to see amazing views and finish at the base of a section called Jug End. The distance on this is 5.5 miles but the elevation gain could be about 1500' to the top of Mt. Everett (elev 2,062'). This will be a challenging experience for all involved but will be very rewarding.

We will begin on Route 41, Undermountain Road near Sheffield MA. We will take the Race Brook Falls Falls Trail to intersect with the AT. From there we are heading north on the white blazed AT up Mt. Everett. The views promise to be spectacular. We continue along the ridge over Mt. Bushnell and then over and down Jug End. The finish spot is on Jug End Road.

We need two cars to shuttle folks. I will certainly coordinate carpooling from the Hartford area. If you are meeting there, please meet at the ending site on Jug End Road at 9:00 a.m. We will shuttle to the beginning from there.

Please wear study hiking boots and bring water (at least one liter). We will eat on the trail for lunch so pack food.

This will be a challenging hike with a great deal on climbing. I expect a hike time of four hours. Please do not plan on bringing dogs to this hike.

This is the spot for where the hike starts. Across from Salisbury Road on Route 41 is a parking area.
